instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG? PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG Is a single phase of CPU VCORE for the graphics processor integrated into the CPU before it is combined into one PPVCORE_S0_AXG rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message:
I have again a strange Macbook Air 11", it turns on but is extremly slow and the fan is going up to max. speed after a 5-10seconds.

No visible liquid damage, tried another battery, harddiscs, all resets and also exchanged the logicboard into a different macbook air. Always same behaviour.

On the apple ASD test I got only 2 errors:

-thunderbolt sleep wake test
-tim test 75percent GB
Pictures are attached!

I have checked especially die CPU temp sensor circuit, all ok. All other voltages are also ok.
Following voltages are going down when the fan is on highspeed, but I assume thats normal due the strange problem:

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> down to 0,8 instead 1,25
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG</SIGNAL> 0,45 instead of 1,05
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL> 0,84 instead of 1,5

Any hint and idea is very appreciated!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message: Using a known good battery, must be A1406 type.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message:
I tried already a good battery from
another 11" macbook. Same behaviour.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message: YES! A1406 battery, which works proper in another macbook.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message: Any history as to how this happened? Liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message: I dont know any detailed history. But there are no signs of liquid on the board, it looks absolutely clean. I am afraid I have to put that project on hold. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> extrem slow and fan runs on highspeed
threads.message: If you know an Apple service provider let them run MRI/AST on it. ASD misses some sensors sometimes.
